name: Ogre
description: Ogres are large, brutish humanoids standing 9 to 10 feet tall, known for their immense size and strength. They wield massive clubs or improvisational weapons, smashing anything in their path.
memorable: Ogres are known for their sheer physical power, capable of delivering devastating melee attacks and launching sweeping strikes that can knock opponents prone.
goals: Ogres are driven by greed and hunger, often raiding villages or travelers for food, treasure, or slaves.
relations: Ogres may be encountered alone or in small bands, often in isolated caves, hills, or ruins.
environment: Ogres usually inhabit caves, hills, or ruins.
strengths: High Strength score gives Ogres powerful melee capabilities, making them formidable in direct combat.
weaknesses: Ogres have low Dexterity, resulting in poor agility and difficulty in dodging attacks.
attacks: Ogres primarily attack using their Greatclub for bludgeoning damage or Javelins for piercing damage, making them versatile in melee or ranged combat.
most_powerful_ability: The Bowling Sweep ability allows the Ogre to deal area damage and knock creatures prone, significantly altering the dynamics of battle.
senses: Ogres have darkvision to see in darkness as if it were dim light, enhancing their awareness in dimly lit areas.
skills: Ogres possess a passive Perception score of 10, indicating average awareness of their surroundings.
additional_information: Ogres are known for their simple-mindedness, making them easily fooled or manipulated.
They can perform a Shoving Rush, knocking targets prone while avoiding opportunity attacks.
Ogres resist being stunned, making them more challenging to incapacitate.
They often wield improvised weapons in addition to their Greatclub.
Ogres can engage in a Multiattack, allowing them to make two actions per turn.
